title: Causal Effect Functions — tau_norm
text: vector individual level causal effects (taus) add ybase (potential outcome control) get y1var potential outcome treatment.

title: Causal Effect Functions — tau_norm
text: tau_norm(): basic function outliers tau_norm_outliers(): Draws Normal also adds outliers. tau_norm_covariate(): basic function specifies tau_sds*2 size effect cov>median(cov) otherwise tau_sds/2 size effect. idea keep average individual effect size functions — .e. tau_sds — make strong simple relationship covariate. tau_norm_covariate_outliers(): basic function specifies tau_sds size effect cov>median(cov) otherwise tau_sds/4 size effect tau_norm_covariate_cont(): basic function specifies tau_sds size effect cov>median(cov) otherwise tau_sds/4 size effect tau_norm_covariate_levels(): basic function specifies tau_sds size effect varies, randomly, level covariate. envision used covariate relatively levels outcome values can grouped.

Default "fdr". simthresh number total observations p-value functions use permutations rather asymptotic approximations sims Number permutations permutation-based testing total number cases threshold. fmla formula outcome~treatment assignment | block treatment assignment block must factors. tests run within block |block part strictly important. parallel pfn use multicore processing permutation based testing? Default . "snow" "multicore" following approximate coin package. ncores number cores use p-value creation function copydts TRUE FALSE. TRUE using standalone. FALSE copied objects sent function functions. Basically question whether want function change block individual level datasets main environment return new object.

what: Calculate the error and success proportions of tests for a single iteration — calc_errs
title: Calculate the error and success proportions of tests for a single iteration — calc_errs
text: function takes output findBlocks equivalent bottom-testing function adjust_block_tests returns proportions errors made. use function input findBlocks must include column containing true block-level effect. Repeated uses function allow us assess false discovery rates family wise error rates among metrics testing success.

title: Calculate the error and success proportions of tests for a single iteration — calc_errs
code: calc_errs(   testobj,   truevar_name,   trueeffect_tol = .Machine$double.eps,   blockid = "bF",   thealpha = 0.05,   fwer = FALSE,   return_details = FALSE )

title: Calculate the error and success proportions of tests for a single iteration — calc_errs
text: testobj object arising findBlocks adjust_block_tests. contain block-level results. truevar_name string indicating name variable containing true underlying causal effect (block level). trueeffect_tol smallest effect size consider effect zero (default floating point zero). blockid character name column idat bdat indicating block. thealpha error rate given test (cases alphafn NULL, starting alpha alphafn null) fwer Indicates trying control FWER. Right now, default report_detections indicates looking FDR return_details TRUE means function return list original data ("detobj"), summary results ("detresults"),  node level dataset  ("detnodes"), copy original object provided input. Default FALSE. use TRUE using simulations.

title: Calculate the error and success proportions of tests for a single iteration — calc_errs
text: hit means $p  $ given block group blocks testing stopped, allnull means effects group blocks (single block) zero, anynotnull means least one block non-zero effect, code returns different basic descriptions errors. also summarize average treatment effects blocks (groups blocks) among blocks null hypothesis effects rejected rejected. "nreject" Number tests $p  $ "naccept" Number tests $p > $ "prop_reject" Proportion tests $p  $ tests completed "prop_accept" Proportion tests $p > $ tests completed "true_pos_prop" Proportion tests $p  $ tests true null hypotheses (rejections false null hypotheses) "false_pos_prop" Proportion tests $p  $ tests false null hypotheses (rejections true null hypotheses) "true_neg_prop" "false_neg_prop" "false_disc_prop" "true_disc_prop" "true_nondisc_prop" "false_nondisc_prop" "meangrpsize" "medgrpsize" "hit1" "minate1" "meanate1" "medate1" "maxate1" "hit0" "minate0" "meanate0" "medate0" "maxate0"
code: deterrs <- detnodes[, .(  nreject = sum(hit),  naccept = sum(1 - hit),  prop_reject = mean(hit),  prop_accept = mean(1 - hit), # or 1-prop_reject  # rejections of false null /detections of true non-null  # (if any of the blocks have an effect, then we count this as a correct rejection or correct detection)  true_pos_prop = mean(hit * anynotnull),  # If we reject but *all* of the blocks have no effects, this is a false positive error  # If we reject but only one of them has no effects but the other has effects,  # then this is not an error --- but a correct detection  false_pos_prop = mean(hit * allnull),  # If we do not reject and all blocks are truly null, then we have no error.  true_neg_prop = mean((1 - hit) * allnull),  # If we do not reject/detect and at least one of the blocks actually has an effect, we have  # a false negative error --- a failure to detect the truth  false_neg_prop = mean((1 - hit) * anynotnull),  # Now look at false and true discoveries: false rejections as a proportion of rejections  false_disc_prop = sum(hit * allnull) / max(1, sum(hit)),  true_disc_prop = sum(hit * anynotnull) / max(1, sum(hit)),  true_nondisc_prop = sum((1 - hit) * allnull) / max(1, sum(1 - hit)),  false_nondisc_prop = sum((1 - hit) * anynotnull) / max(1, sum(1 - hit)),  meangrpsize = mean(grpsize),  medgrpsize = median(grpsize) )]

title: Simulate Treatment Effects — create_effects
text: idat Unit-level data. object inheriting class data.table ybase Baseline potential outcome variable name, string. blockid Name block variable (blocking variable factor) tau_fn function taking y0 tau_size produce treatment effect unit tau_size rough mean size treatment effect (like mean shift), sds probably. covariate Contains information covariates currently character name column idat. NULL used. prop_blocks_0 proportion blocks zero treatment effect. by_block TRUE block separate shift (like mean shift) otherwise create individual level treatment effect separately within block FALSE create effect across blocks (ignoring blocks).

title: Error assessment function — errsimfn
text: idat Unit-level data. object inheriting class data.table bdat Block-level data. object inheriting class data.table pfn function  produce p-values (see pWilcox example). splitfn function splitting data, see splitLOO example. fmla formula relating outcomes   treatment blocks ( passed  pfn). blockid character name column idat bdat indicating block. trtvar name treatment numeric, (0,1), variable ybase potential outcome control upon treatment effect built afn function adjust alpha step. Takes one p-values plus stratum batch indicator. thealpha alpha level test. tau_fn function turns ybase potential outcome treatment — treatment effect creating function. tau_size parameter tau_fn — like true average effect size within block. prop_blocks_0 proportion blocks treatment effect . sims number simulations run — simulation uses treatment effects re-assigns treatment (re-shuffles treatment re-reveals observed outcomes function potential outcomes)

title: Test, Split, Repeat — findBlocks
text: Split test.

title: Test, Split, Repeat — findBlocks
code: findBlocks(   idat,   bdat,   blockid = "block",   splitfn,   pfn,   alphafn = NULL,   simthresh = 20,   sims = 1000,   maxtest = 2000,   thealpha = 0.05,   thew0 = 0.05 - 0.001,   fmla = YContNorm ~ trtF | blockF,   parallel = "multicore",   ncores = 4,   copydts = FALSE,   splitby = "hwt",   stop_splitby_constant = TRUE,   blocksize = "hwt",   trace = FALSE )

title: Test, Split, Repeat — findBlocks
text: idat Data unit level. bdat Data block level. blockid character name column idat bdat indicating block. splitfn function split data two pieces — using bdat pfn function produce pvalues — using idat. alphafn function adjust alpha step. Takes one p-values plus stratum batch indicator. Currently alpha_investing, alpha_saffron, alpha_addis accepted. wrap corresponding functions onlineFDR package. simthresh number total observations p-value functions use permutations rather asymptotic approximations sims Number permutations permutation-based testing maxtest Maximum splits tests . probably smaller number experimental blocks. thealpha error rate given test (cases alphafn NULL, starting alpha alphafn null) thew0 starting "wealth" alpha investing procedure (relevant alphafn null). fmla formula outcome~treatment assignment  | block treatment assignment block must factors. parallel pfn use multicore processing permutation based testing. Default . "snow" "multicore" following approximate coin package. ncores number cores used parallel processing copydts TRUE FALSE. TRUE using findBlocks standalone. FALSE copied objects sent findBlocks functions. splitby string indicating column bdat contains variable guide splitting (example, column block sizes block harmonic mean weights column covariate (function covariates) column factor levels separated "." indicates pre-specified series splits (see splitSpecifiedFactor)) stop_splitby_constant TRUE splitting stop splitby constant within given branch tree. FALSE splitting continue even splitby constant. Default TRUE. Different combinations splitby, splitfn, stop_splitby_constant make less sense described . blocksize string name column bdat contains information size block (determinant power tests within block, harmonic mean weight block variance outcome within block.) trace Logical, FALSE (default) print split number. TRUE prints split number.

title: Test, Split, Repeat — findBlocks
text: data.table containing information sequence splitting testing

title: Test, Split, Repeat — findBlocks
text: notes splitting functions relate splitting criteria (splitby) stopping criteria (stop_splitby_constant). splitLOO() chooses blocks largest splitby vector one time two tests, one focusing highest ranked block one rest blocks (example, block units versus rest blocks). splitby vector ties, chooses one block random among tied first largest rank. split vector values, example, two values, still split assuming vector numeric (, 1 ranked higher 0) randomly among ties. stop_splitby_constant=TRUE, algorithm stop exhausting blocks higher ranked category (thinking binary splitby case). reason advise using splitLOO factor splitby vector categories. splitLOO() best used splitby vector like block-size — constant thus just create random choice single block vary thus focus testing largest/highest ranked blocks. splitEqualApprox() splits sets blocks two groups sum splitby vector approximately split. example, splitby number units block, splitting function makes two groups blocks, group total number units. splitting function work discrete factors : rank_splitby <- rank(splitby) divide blocks groups based taking every rank. , factors variables categories ordered, allocate every category one another group. splitCluster() splits blocks groups similar possible splitby using kmeans clustering algorithm (using combination kmeans() KMeans_rcpp()). work factor variables. splitting criteria constant, return random splits roughly two equal sized groups blocks stop_splitby_constant=FALSE. stop_splitby_constant=TRUE findBlocks() stop return groups blocks detected . splitSpecifiedFactor() split blocks two groups following prespecified pattern encoded labels levels factor. example, imagine three nested levels splitting (like states, districts, neighborhoods), factor labels like category1_level1.category2_level1.category3_level1 splits occur left right depending whether existing variation level. factor constant stop_splitby_constant=TRUE splitting stops. reason recommend right-label factor individual blocks —ensure testing descends block level can. stop_splitby_constant=FALSE, uses random splits. splitSpecifiedFactorMulti() split blocks two groups following prespecified pattern encoded labels levels factor. example, imagine three nested levels splitting (like states, districts, neighborhoods), factor labels like category1_level1.category2_level1.category3_level1 splits occur left right depending whether existing variation level. reason recommend right-label factor individual blocks —ensure testing descends block level can. factor constant stop_splitby_constant=TRUE splitting stops. stop_splitby_constant=FALSE, uses random splits.

code: padj_test_fn(   idat,   bdat,   blockid,   trtid = "trt",   fmla = Y ~ trtF | blockF,   ybase,   prop_blocks_0,   tau_fn,   tau_size,   by_block = TRUE,   pfn,   afn,   p_adj_method,   nsims,   ncores = 1,   splitfn = NULL,   covariate = NULL,   splitby = NULL,   thealpha = 0.05,   stop_splitby_constant = TRUE,   return_details = FALSE )

title: Create treatment effect, then add tau and test using the SIUP method — padj_test_fn
text: idat Individual level data bdat Data block level. blockid character name column idat bdat indicating block. trtid name treatment numeric, (0,1), variable fmla formula outcome~treatment assignment  | block treatment assignment block must factors. ybase potential outcome control upon treatment effect built prop_blocks_0 proportion blocks effects tau_fn function turns ybase potential outcome treatment — treatment effect creating function. tau_size parameter tau_fn — like true average effect size within block. by_block argument create_effects create true effects block across whole dataset pfn function produce pvalues — using idat. afn function adjust alpha step. Takes one p-values plus stratum batch indicator. p_adj_method "split" use findBlocks top-testing "fdr" "holm" etc use stats::p.adjust test every block. nsims number simulations run — simulation uses treatment effects re-assigns treatment (re-shuffles treatment re-reveals observed outcomes function potential outcomes) ncores Tells p-value functions many cores use. Mostly ignored use function tending parallelize higher loops. splitfn function split data two pieces — using bdat covariate name covariate used created covariate dependent treatment effects. NULL tau_fn use covariate. "newcov", create new covariate known (moderate) relationship potential outcome control. relationship currently fixed R^2 .1. splitby string indicating column bdat contains variable guide splitting (example, column block sizes block harmonic mean weights column covariate (function covariates)) thealpha error rate given test (cases alphafn NULL, starting alpha alphafn null) stop_splitby_constant TRUE algorithm stop splitting splitting criteria constant within set/parent whether continue split randomly. return_details TRUE means function return list original data ("detobj"), summary results ("detresults"), node level dataset  ("detnodes"). Default FALSE. use TRUE using simulations.
